    • canBuildCity

      public boolean canBuildCity()
      . canBuildCity Check if the player can build a city it checks if the player has enough resources and if the resources have been given
      Returns:
      true if the player can build a city, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • to see how the cost is calculated.

    • buildCityButtonAction

      public void buildCityButtonAction()
      . buildCityButtonAction This method is called when the player clicks on the "build city" button It checks if the player can build a city and if the player has a colony If the player can build a city and has a colony, it sets the board to look for a vertex If the board is already looking for a vertex, it sets the board to not look for a vertex It also sets the board to not place a city, a road or a colony If the board is looking for an edge, it sets the board to not look for an edge

    • canBuildColony

      public boolean canBuildColony()
      . canBuildColony Check if the player can build a colony it checks if the player has enough resources and if the resources have been given
      Returns:
      true if the player can build a colony, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • to see how the cost is calculated

    • buildColonyButtonAction

      public void buildColonyButtonAction()
      . buildColonyButtonAction This method is called when the player clicks on the "build colony" button It checks if the player can build a colony and if the resources have been given If the player can build a colony and the resources have been given, it sets the board to look for a vertex If the board is already looking for a vertex, it sets the board to not look for a vertex It also sets the board to not place a city, a road or a colony If the board is looking for an edge, it sets the board to not look for an edge

    • canBuildRoad

      public boolean canBuildRoad()
      . canBuildRoad Check if the player can build a road it checks if the player has enough resources and if the resources have been given
      Returns:
      true if the player can build a road, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • to see how the cost is calculated

    • buildRoadButtonAction

      public void buildRoadButtonAction()
      . buildRoadButtonAction This method is called when the player clicks on the "build road" button It checks if the player can build a road and if the resources have been given If the player can build a road and the resources have been given, it sets the board to look for an edge If the board is already looking for an edge, it sets the board to not look for an edge It also sets the board to not place a city, a road or a colony If the board is looking for a vertex, it sets the board to not look for a vertex

    • networkBuildColony

      public void networkBuildColony()

    • buildColony

      public boolean buildColony(int idVertex) throws ConstructBuildingException
      . buildColony This method is called when the player clicks on a vertex to build a colony It checks if the player can build a colony and if the resources have been given If the player can build a colony and the resources have been given, it builds a colony on the vertex
      Parameters:
      idVertex - the id of the vertex where the player wants to build a colony
      Returns:
      boolean the colony has been built
      Throws:
      ConstructBuildingException - if the player can't build a colony on the vertex

    • networkBuildRoad

      public void networkBuildRoad()

    • buildRoad

      public boolean buildRoad(int idEdge) throws ConstructBuildingException
      . buildRoad
      Parameters:
      idEdge - the id of the edge where the player wants to build a road
      Returns:
      boolean the road has been built
      Throws:
      ConstructBuildingException - if the player can't build a road on the edge
      See Also:
      • ConstructBuildingException
      • Player.buildRoad(model.tiles.TileEdge)

    • buildCity

      public boolean buildCity(int idVertex, boolean us) throws ConstructBuildingException
      . buildCity
      Parameters:
      idVertex - the id of the vertex where the player wants to build a city
      us - Indicates if we are the player building the city
      Returns:
      boolean the city has been built
      Throws:
      ConstructBuildingException - if the player can't build a city on the vertex
      See Also:
